snippet: A private, family-requested autopsy shows that Michael Brown was shot at least six times — twice in the head — with all of the bullets striking him in the front.
abstract: Preliminary private autopsy reveals that black teenager Michael Brown was shot at least six times, including twice in the head, by police officer in Ferguson, Mo; autopsy was conducted by Dr Michael M Baden, former chief medical examiner of the City of New York, at the behest of Brown's family; results represent first time that critical information concerning Brown's death has been made public, as thousands continue to protest and demand justice for what is widely viewed as a reckless shooting.

byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES and JULIE BOSMAN

lead_paragraph: A private, family-requested autopsy shows that Michael Brown was shot at least six times — twice in the head — with all of the bullets striking him in the front.

headline.main: Autopsy Shows Michael Brown Was Struck at Least 6 Times
headline.print_headline: Missouri Shooting Victim Was Hit at Least 6 Times
